question:
In context with the recent test firing of Shaheen-I, consider the following statements:
  1. It is a surface-to-surface ballistic missile.
  2. It was tested by Iran.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: Shaheen-I is a surface to surface ballistic missile. It has a strike range of 650km. It is capable of carrying and delivering all types of nuclear warheads. It was named after a species of predatory bird called falcon. It operates on solid fuel.    Statement 2 is incorrect: The Shaheen-I missile was tested by Pakistan in November. This was days after India conducted its first night-time test of Agni-II. The Shaheen-I test was conducted to test the operational readiness of Pakistan’s Army Strategic Forces Command or ASFC.
